time_sink.title: Time Sink Metric
time_sink.desc: Identifies code that is constantly being rewritten across multiple PRs.

privacy.title: Privacy First
privacy.desc: We only analyze metadata and stats. Your source code never leaves GitHub.

instant.title: Instant Analysis
instant.desc: Connect a repo and get insights in seconds. No complex setup required.

empty_state.no_repo_desc: Select a repository from your connected installations to start monitoring development signals, churn, and team distribution.

time_sink.title: Time Sink
time_sink.tooltip: Measures engineering rework by tracking how often files are modified shortly after being merged. High churn suggests technical debt or changing requirements.

truck_factor.title: Truck Factor
truck_factor.subtitle: Knowledge Silos & Hero Developers
truck_factor.description: Also known as the Bus Factor. It calculates how many key developers would need to be 'hit by a truck' before the project stalls due to knowledge silos.
truck_factor.no_silos: No silos detected. Knowledge appears well distributed.

pulse.title: Pulse
pulse.tooltip: Development cadence and velocity. High cadence indicates frequent shipping and momentum. Sporadic activity might suggest project instability.

codebase_age.title: Codebase Age
codebase_age.tooltip: Estimates the 'effective year' of the codebase based on used tools, libraries, and coding styles. Shows how modern or legacy the project feels.
codebase_age.disclaimer: * This is an automated assessment of project signatures and may not reflect manual architectural efforts.
